title: Bug 37021 - Source Path Incorrect in Declare Warning on Binary Files
description: Bug 37021 - Source Path Incorrect in Declare Warning on Binary Files [java|aj]. See tests/new/binaryWarnings/.. for code to run to see the problem. Limitations of the tests: These tests return false positives when detecting this error because filename checking is not enabled in harness verification of messages. (I saw it in AJDT, so perhaps if the filename makes no sense to AJDT, AJDT simply omits it.)
OB: In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the source path is listed in the form "app.Main.class" rather than "app/Main". I have also seen the filenames not appear at all, but these tests do not reproduce that problem.
EB: The source path in declare warning messages targeting .class files should be listed in the form "app/Main" instead of "app.Main.class". Additionally, filenames should always appear in the declare warning messages.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Run the code in tests/new/binaryWarnings/..
2. Check declare warning messages targeting .class files from injars.
3. Verify that the source path is incorrectly listed as "app.Main.class" instead of "app/Main".
